Lyrics: Como Santa María se vingou do escudeiro que déu couce na pórta da sa eigreja.
Direct Translation: How Holy Mary took vengeance on the squire who kicked the door of Her church.

Lyrics: Mal s' á end' achar
Direct Translation: Whoever tries to dishonor Holy Mary
Poetic Translation: Vengeance will befall

Lyrics: quen quisér desonrrar Santa María.
Direct Translation: will suffer for it,
Poetic Translation: Anyone who tries to desecrate Mary.

Lyrics: Como s' achou, non á i mui gran sazôn,
Direct Translation: as suffered not long ago
Poetic Translation: That's what happened in Galicia, people swore,

Lyrics: en Galiza un escudeiraz peôn
Direct Translation: a foot squire in Galicia
Poetic Translation: To a squire who tried to wreck the church's door

Lyrics: que quis mui felôn
Direct Translation: who angrily tried to break
Poetic Translation: With any angry roar,

Lyrics: britá-la eigreja con felonía.
Direct Translation: the door of the church in a rage.
Poetic Translation: In a fury that was mindless and scary.

Lyrics: Santa María a ermida nom' á
Direct Translation: The hermitage is named Holy Mary
Poetic Translation: Holy Mary of the Mountain it was named,

Lyrics: do Monte, porque en logar alt' está;
Direct Translation: of the Mountain, because it stands on a high place,
Poetic Translation: The distinguished hermitage where he was shamed

Lyrics: e foron alá
Direct Translation: and a great pilgrimage
Poetic Translation: And Her vengeance flamed.

Lyrics: de gentes entôn mui gran romaría
Direct Translation: of many people went there at that time
Poetic Translation: Many pilgrims came to worship and tarried.

Lyrics: En ũa fésta, per com' éu aprendí,
Direct Translation: on a feast day in the middle of August*,
Poetic Translation: On a feast in August, the Assumption Day,

Lyrics: de meant' Agosto. E pois chegou i
Direct Translation: according to what I learned.
Poetic Translation: That was when the squire was there, or so they say.

Lyrics: gran gent', e des i
Direct Translation: A crowd of people arrived there
Poetic Translation: People came to pray,

Lyrics: começaron a tẽer sa vigía.
Direct Translation: and began to hold their vigil.
Poetic Translation: Crowds of worshipers, at peace and unwary.

Lyrics: O escudeiro que vos dixe chegou
Direct Translation: The squire of whom I told you arrived
Poetic Translation: He arrived, the squire I just now said was there,

Lyrics: e viu ũa moça, de que se pagou,
Direct Translation: and saw a girl who caught his fancy,
Poetic Translation: And he saw a pilgrim girl he thought was fair.

Lyrics: que forçar cuidou;
Direct Translation: and he tried to force her,
Poetic Translation: She ignored his stare,

Lyrics: mais ela per ren non llo consentía.
Direct Translation: but she would not allow it by any means.
Poetic Translation: So he grabbed her arm, but she yelled how dare he?!

Lyrics: E travando dela cuidou-a forçar;
Direct Translation: He seized her and tried to abuse her,
Poetic Translation: Seizing her, he threw her down upon the sand,

Lyrics: mais proug' a Déus e nono pod' acabar,
Direct Translation: but God did not wish it, and he could not have his way,
Poetic Translation: But the Lord denied the vicious crime he planned:

Lyrics: ca foi-ll' escapar
Direct Translation: for she got away from him
Poetic Translation: For he dodged his hand

Lyrics: e fogind' á eigreja se collía.
Direct Translation: and fled to take reuge in the church.
Poetic Translation: And made for the church, escaping him barely.

Lyrics: Aos braados a gente recodiu,
Direct Translation: The people came in response to the cries,
Poetic Translation: People ran to help her when her cries were heard,

Lyrics: e a mininna mercee lles pediu
Direct Translation: and the girl asked them to please
Poetic Translation: And she begged for safety from the threats he slurred,

Lyrics: que daquel que viu
Direct Translation: protect her from the threats
Poetic Translation: For each savage word

Lyrics: a quiséssen guardar de sa perfía.
Direct Translation: of that man she had seen.
Poetic Translation: From his cursing mouth was wicked and scary.

Lyrics: As gentes, temendo de lles vĩir mal,
Direct Translation: The people, fearing harm,
Poetic Translation: Uncontrollable was he, so they took fright;

Lyrics: foron sarrá-las pórtas lógo sen al,
Direct Translation: closed the doors at once,
Poetic Translation: All the doors were bolted to prevent a fight,

Lyrics: e chamando: "Val,
Direct Translation: crying: "Help us,
Poetic Translation: And they prayed for might:

Lyrics: Madre de Déus, ca mestér nos sería."
Direct Translation: Mother of God, for we are in need."
Poetic Translation: Help us, Mother of our God, Holy Mary!

Lyrics: O escudeiro, tanto que viu fugir
Direct Translation: The squire, as soon as he saw the girl flee from him,
Poetic Translation: Once the squire had noticed that she ran away,

Lyrics: a moça, leixou-se depós ela ir
Direct Translation: set out after her,
Poetic Translation: He set out to catch her, growling at his prey,

Lyrics: dizendo: "Guarir
Direct Translation: saying: "You cannot
Poetic Translation: Dumb-ass bitch, you’ll pay—

Lyrics: non me pódes, rapariga sandía."
Direct Translation: get away from me, foolish wench."
Poetic Translation: By my hand, I’ll teach you to be contrary.

Lyrics: E quando as pórtas sarradas achou,
Direct Translation: When he found the doors closed,
Poetic Translation: When he reached the church and saw the doors were closed,

Lyrics: per poucas que de sanna sandeu tornou,
Direct Translation: he almost went mad with rage
Poetic Translation: Screaming in his rage and swearing, he proposed

Lyrics: e lógo jurou
Direct Translation: and swore on the spot
Poetic Translation: That the doors opposed

Lyrics: que a couces toda-las britaría.
Direct Translation: that he would kick them down.
Poetic Translation: He would kick to bits, burst in, take his fair fee.

Lyrics: E com' éra atrevudo e sandeu,
Direct Translation: As he was bold and foolhardy,
Poetic Translation: He was bold and foolish, and he really tried

Lyrics: quis acabar aquelo que prometeu,
Direct Translation: he tried to carry out his threat.
Poetic Translation: To effect the threat he'd boorishly supplied,

Lyrics: e o pé ergeu
Direct Translation: He raised his foot
Poetic Translation: And he stood in pride,

Lyrics: e ena pórta gran couce dar ía.
Direct Translation: and was about to give the door a powerful kick.
Poetic Translation: Raising up his foot and shouting, "Beware me!"

Lyrics: Mais avẽo-ll' en como vos éu direi:
Direct Translation: However, I shall tell you what happened to him.
Poetic Translation: Here is just what happened, as I heard from folk:

Lyrics: britou-xe-ll' a pérna, segund' apres' ei,
Direct Translation: His leg broke, according to what I learned,
Poetic Translation: He could not break down the door with any stroke,

Lyrics: per prazer do Rei,
Direct Translation: because of the will of the King,
Poetic Translation: But his leg he broke,

Lyrics: Fillo da Virgen, a que desprazía.
Direct Translation: Son of the Virgin, Who was displeased by this.
Poetic Translation: For God hates to see us treated unfairly.

Lyrics: E d' al ll' avẽo aínda mui peior:
Direct Translation: And something much worse happened to him:
Poetic Translation: And not only did he injury sustain,

Lyrics: esmoreceu con coita e con door,
Direct Translation: he fainted in shock and pain,
Poetic Translation: But he fainted dead away from shock and pain,

Lyrics: e Nóstro Sennor
Direct Translation: and Our Lord
Poetic Translation: And he went insane,

Lyrics: sen tod' aquest' a fala lle tollía
Direct Translation: in addition took away his speech
Poetic Translation: And he couldn't speak a whisper, or barely.

Lyrics: En tal guisa, que pois nunca disse ren
Direct Translation: so that he could never say anything
Poetic Translation: Mary's name was all he could say anymore.

Lyrics: érgo "ai, Santa María." E des ên
Direct Translation: except "Oh, Holy Mary," and after that,
Poetic Translation: After that, insane and maimed, he wandered, poor,

Lyrics: tolleit' e sen sen
Direct Translation: maimed and crazy,
Poetic Translation: Begging door to door,

Lyrics: viveu gran temp' e per pórtas pidía.
Direct Translation: he lived a long time and begged from door to door.
Poetic Translation: Living with the crime that he had to carry.

Lyrics: Alfonso X el Sabio, King of Castile and León
